content: as explained for the upper back until work measures 7/8/9/11/12 cm = 2 75/3/3 5/4/4 25/ measured from the underarm where you split for front and back and ending with a ws row on the following rs row divide sts for left and right side of front bind off sts for neck row 1 rs work in pattern as established over 21/25/29/33/35 sts bind off 21/23/25/27/33 sts work in pattern as established over 21/25/29/33/35 sts right shoulder continue work over the last 21/25/29/33/35 sts in the row for right shoulder place the first 21/25/29/33/35 sts in the row for left side of front on a separate holder/waste yarn if putting the sts on waste yarn please make sure to secure the yarn properly to avoid dropping sts turn work and work 1 row from ws in guernsey-pattern as est across 21/25/29/33/35 sts start the rib-patterned button-band on the following rs row row 1 rs ssk k1 p1 repeat - until 1 st rem k1 row 2 ws p3 work in rib-pattern as est in row 1 row 3 rs ssk work in rib-pattern as est 19/23/27/31/33 sts rem work 3 more row in rib-pattern bind off all sts from rs in rib-pattern as the sts are showing k and p sts break and secure yarn left shoulder carefully transfer the 21/25/29/33/35 sts from the separate holder/waste yarn to the same needle as used for the right shoulder start working from ws from the neck-side to the sleeve-side work 1 row from ws in guernsey pattern as est across 21/25/29/33/35 sts row 1 rs work in pattern as est until 2 sts rem in the row k2tog row 2 ws work in pattern as est to end of row row 3 rs work in pattern as est until 2 sts rem in the row k2tog 19/23/27/31/33 sts rem the 3 following row continue work in pattern as est over the rem 19/23/27/31/33 sts break yarn leave a yarn-tail long enough for grafting or knitting the shoulder-sts together from ws bind off the left shoulder using the three-needle bind-off method place the 19/23/27/31/33 sts of the left side of the back on a needle work these sts together with the corresponding sts of the left shoulder of the back from ws using the 3-needle bind-off method you may also graft the sts together from rs if preferred 6 neckline before working the sleeves you may work the neckline or save the neckline until you have worked the sleeves it doesn t matter in which order you choose to work them the ribbed neckline is worked back and forth from picked-up and spared sts the back neck sts a buttonhole is created at the height of the buttonhole-band of the right shoulder from rs using the circular needle 3 mm/us2 5 pick up and knit 7 sts from the short edge of the buttonhole-band pick up and knit across 25/27/29/31/37 sts from the back pick up and knit 9 sts from the left
